item.title: Nurse Lucy Letby to be sentenced for murdering seven babies
item.description: The conviction on Friday made Lucy Letby the UK's most prolific child serial killer in modern times.

item.title: Spain's winning scorer Carmona told after final her father had died
item.description: Olga Carmona, who scored Spain's winner in the Women's World Cup final, is told after the game against England that her father has died.

item.title: Watch highlights of the final - five minutes of the best action
item.description: England's wait to win a first Women's World Cup goes on after defeat by Spain in the 2023 final in Sydney.

item.title: Donald Trump confirms he will skip Republican presidential debates
item.description: The US ex-president says he is far ahead of his rivals in the 2024 White House race and the public knows him.

item.title: Sara Sharif murder inquiry: Girl known to authorities, council says
item.description: Surrey County Council says it is "working tirelessly" to understand what happened to Sara.

item.title: Ecuador chooses president amid spike in violence
item.description: The campaign was overshadowed by a wave of shootings, including the assassination of a candidate.

item.title: In Pictures: Kate Winslet surprises crowds at Camp Bestival
item.description: Festival-goers in the CBeebies Bedtime Story tent are treated to a reading by Kate Winslet.

item.title: Canada wildfires: At least 30,000 households in British Columbia told to evacuate
item.description: Officials restrict travel to Kelowna, a lakeside city of 132,000 people where smoke hangs on the water.

item.title: Man kills shopkeeper in US state of California after disparaging Pride flag
item.description: The gunman is shot dead by police, as Hollywood director Paul Feig pays tribute to the victim.

item.title: Baghdad advertising boards turned off over porn screening
item.description: Electronic screens were shut down after a hacker used one to run a pornographic film.

item.title: Burnt-out shell of 1954 Ferrari fetches $2m at auction
item.description: The legendary car was left untouched for decades until a hurricane blew the roof off a Florida barn.

item.title: The Papers: 'Heartbreak' for England who 'did us all proud'
item.description: The Lionesses narrow 1-0 loss to Spain in the World Cup final in Australia leads Monday's papers.

item.title: British Museum: How easy is it to steal from a museum?
item.description: Stolen items from the British Museum spark debate over the safety of the world's greatest treasures.

item.title: England fans in tears as Spain supporters ecstatic
item.description: England fans are heartbroken after their one-nil defeat to jubilant Spain in the Women's World Cup final.

item.title: Crazy Rich Agents: ‘I sell houses to billionaires but live with mum and dad’
item.description: Young luxury estate agents face pressure to succeed in BBC's Crazy Rich Agents.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'summer walks'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Jews in the German Army: Different generations reflect on changing attitudes
item.description: How Germany's reckoning with its past has changed the experience of Jews in the Armed Forces.

item.title: Have airlines gone too far with their extra fees?
item.description: Airlines increasingly charge for perks like speedy booking and seat selection, but some passengers say the costs are too high

item.title: Drew Findling: Trump's new lawyer once called him 'racist, cruel'
item.description: Drew Findling, dubbed the Billion Dollar Lawyer, defends rappers. Why is he representing Mr Trump?

item.title: Cats: The mum and daughter living with more than 70 pets
item.description: Karen and Lauren say their "therapeutic" way of life has become a "living hell".

item.title: Sleep streams: How Kai Cenat and others make money filming themselves sleep
item.description: One streamer tells us he has stopped making sleep videos after it affected his mental health.

item.title: TV presenter Phil Spencer's parents die in car accident
item.description: The Location, Location, Location host says his family is "sad and shocked beyond all belief".

item.title: William Gladstone's family to apologise for slavery links
item.description: Family of 19th Century prime minister will visit the Caribbean to apologise for an ancestor's role in the slave trade.

item.title: Ukraine war: Russia says drone injures five at Kursk railway station
item.description: Kyiv is accused of attacking the transport hub in Kursk - and also the Rostov and Moscow regions.

item.title: Niger coup leader Gen Tchiani promises to handover power in three years
item.description: Gen Tchiani said that Niger did not want a war but would defend itself against foreign intervention.

item.title: Police officer rescues child and adult from sea at Clacton
item.description: Two people had got into difficulties in the water at Clacton-on-Sea on Saturday afternoon.

item.title: Ron Cephas Jones, This Is Us star, dies aged 66
item.description: The US actor, won two Emmy Awards for his role in the TV series, had long-standing lung problems.

item.title: Man dies after fall from cruise ship at Port of Cromarty Firth
item.description: The Viking Cruises crew member was airlifted to Aberdeen Royal Infirmary after the incident on Friday.

item.title: Fifa Women's World Cup final: Welsh Guards in musical tribute to Lionesses
item.description: The Welsh Guards play a musical tribute to the Lionesses at the Wellington Barracks in London.

item.title: Waitrose offers police free coffees to deter thieves
item.description: Waitrose and John Lewis are offering free hot drinks under the "Thanks a Latte" initiative.

item.title: Newry: Elderly couple's deaths not being treated as suspicious
item.description: The couple found dead at a home outside Newry are believed to have died some time ago, the PSNI say.

item.title: New shooting mars election campaign in Ecuador
item.description: Another shootout prompts a call to tackle gang violence ahead of Sunday's presidential vote.

item.title: Lucy Letby: Hospital bosses were misled, former chair claims
item.description: NHS trust board was told there was 'no criminal activity pointing to any one individual', he says.

item.title: Canada wildfires: The past 2 days in 75 seconds
item.description: As Canada's northern and western provinces battle historic wildfires, thousands have been displaced.

item.title: Colombia earthquake: Guests leave as live TV broadcast disrupted
item.description: The news anchor remained calm and went to a commercial break.

item.title: Prostate cancer: Incontinence bins call in male toilets
item.description: One prostate cancer patient says he was forced to carry used "nappies" around in a backpack.

item.title: Sudan conflict: Black market AK-47s flood Sudan's capital
item.description: Khartoum has become lawless after four months of war, forcing some residents to arm themselves.

item.title: I worked on the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles movie from thousands of miles away
item.description: Artist Sean Sevestre has played a key role in the creation of the film despite being based in Edinburgh.

item.title: Michel Roux Jr announces closure of Le Gavroche
item.description: The chef is closing his two Michelin-starred restaurant in Mayfair after 56 years.

item.title: Fans, fires and faces: Photos of the week from around the world
item.description: A selection of striking images from around the world, taken over the past seven days.

item.title: Tribute paid to 'priceless' girl who died in van crash
item.description: Millie Gribble died two days after she and two teenagers were struck by a van, police say.

item.title: World Athletics Championships 2023: Katarina Johnson-Thompson & Zharnel Hughes star for GB
item.description: Katarina Johnson-Thompson says winning world heptathlon gold in Budapest is "like being in a dream" on a stellar night for GB in Budapest.

item.title: World Athletics Championships 2023: Katarina Johnson-Thompson wins heptathlon gold in tense 800m
item.description: Watch the winning moment as Great Britain's Katarina Johnson-Thompson secures heptathlon gold in a thrilling 800m race.

item.title: Aston Villa 4-0 Everton: 'Worrying how bad Toffees were at basics' - Martin Keown analysis
item.description: MOTD2 pundit Martin Keown says it was worrying to see exactly how bad Everton's basics were in the 4-0 defeat at Aston Villa on Sunday.

item.title: World Athletics Championships 2023: Zharnel Hughes takes bronze as Noah Lyles wins men's 100m
item.description: Watch as Great Britain's Zharnel Hughes takes bronze in the men's 100m, while Noah Lyles of the United States wins gold.

item.title: Lucas Paqueta: West Ham boss David Moyes had no doubts about midfielder
item.description: West Ham United manager David Moyes says there was "never any doubt" about playing Lucas Paqueta in the 3-1 win against Chelsea.

item.title: World Athletics Championships 2023: How Katarina Johnson-Thompson won heptathlon gold
item.description: Watch Katarina Johnson-Thompson's performances in all seven events as she becomes world heptathlon champion for the second time.

item.title: Kilmarnock 1-0 Celtic: 'Wee advantage' leaves Brendan Rodgers asking questions
item.description: After Celtic having never lost a domestic cup game under Brendan Rodgers, Kilmarnock shock them in the first tie of the manager's second spell.

item.title: Women World Cup: England goalkeeper Mary Earps wins Golden Glove award
item.description: England's Mary Earps is named the best goalkeeper at the 2023 Women's World Cup and wins the Golden Glove award.

item.title: 'We're gutted but they've done country proud' - England fans react
item.description: Tearful fans still adore this England side after Women's World Cup final heartbreak.

item.title: Women's World Cup: Fans rejoice in Madrid as Spain makes football history
item.description: As their team wins its first-ever World Cup in Sydney, supporters of women's football celebrate back home.

item.title: Lionesses 'inspired' nation despite defeat - William
item.description: The Prince of Wales has led a flood of support for England after they narrowly lost the World Cup final.

item.title: England lose Women's World Cup final: Lionesses miss opportunity to cement legend status
item.description: When the full-time whistle was blown in Sydney, it felt like the Lionesses' best opportunity to win a Women's World Cup had passed them by.

item.title: England 'heartbroken' after Women's World Cup final defeat by Spain, says Millie Bright
item.description: England captain Millie Bright says the defeat to Spain in the Women's World Cup final is "really hard to take".

item.title: Carmona scores World Cup winner for Spain
item.description: Watch Olga Carmona score the winner for Spain as they beat England 1-0 in the Women's World Cup final in Sydney.

item.title: Women's World Cup 2023: Jorge Vilda says Spain players are 'eternal' after they beat England
item.description: Spain boss Jorge Vilda says his players are "eternal" and have a "star on their chest forever" after they defeat England to win the Fifa Women's World Cup.

item.title: Women's World Cup: Watch Mary Earps penalty save following VAR handball review
item.description: Watch England goalkeeper Mary Earps saves Jennifer Hermoso's penalty in the Women's World Cup final.

item.title: Rate the players
item.description: England goalkeeper Mary Earps is named your player of the match after saving a penalty in their 1-0 Women's World Cup final defeat by Spain.

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.title: Rent increases: What you can do about a rise from your landlord
item.description: The BBC's Lora Jones tells you four things you can do, if your landlord asks for more money.

item.title: Cost of living: Five tips when asking for a pay rise
item.description: Recruiters, a manager and a workplace psychologist give their advice on how to negotiate for more money.

item.title: Rent prices: How much have they gone up in your area?
item.description: Use our interactive tool to find out what the average rent is in your area.

item.title: What is the UK inflation rate and why is it so high?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising remains high, driven by soaring food prices.

item.title: Fuel cost: How to save petrol and diesel
item.description: With weak competition adding to fuel prices, are drivers doing the right things to save money?

item.title: Interest rate and mortgages: What you can do about rising payments
item.description: Watch the BBC's Lora Jones tell you five things you can do about your mortgage, in a minute.

item.title: Food prices: How can I save money on my grocery shop?
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis continues to bite. Here are some things that can reduce the impact.

item.title: Debt: What do I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

item.title: Renting: Three ways to win the race to securing a property
item.description: From being first in the queue to being more flexible, here are some tips on how to get ahead in the rental race.

item.title: Cheaper train tickets: Five ways to save money
item.description: As rail fares increase, we find the ways passengers can keep journeys as cheap as possible.

item.title: Interest rates: How a rise affects you and your money
item.description: The Bank of England has put up interest rates 14 times in a bid to slow price rises.

item.title: Why inflation is falling but prices are still rising
item.description: We report this percentage every month but here are three things you may not know.

item.title: How to get a job: Six expert tips for finding work
item.description: There are 10m people out of work in the UK, so if you're searching for a job you're not alone. Here are some tips on how to get started.

item.title: Five ways to save money on your packed lunch
item.description: As the cost of food continues to rise, we hear some top tips on making savings at lunchtime.
